Overview

What is Zoom?

Zoom is a unified communications platform primarily known for its use as a web conferencing tool. It features HD video and audio, collaboration tools, chat functionality, and an enterprise cloud phone system.

What is Zoom?

Zoom One brings together team chat, phone, whiteboard, and meetings in one offering. Purpose-built to work together, Zoom One provides simplified management and delivers communications flexibility to power modern workforces.

Frequently Asked Questions

Zoom is a unified communications platform primarily known for its use as a web conferencing tool. It features HD video and audio, collaboration tools, chat functionality, and an enterprise cloud phone system.

Webex Meetings, GoTo Meeting, and BlueJeans Meetings (discontinued) are common alternatives for Zoom.

Reviewers rate Desktop sharing and Call recording highest, with a score of 8.1.

The most common users of Zoom are from Mid-sized Companies (51-1,000 employees).

Careless customer service

Verified User
C-Level Executive in Information Technology
Computer & Network Security Company, 11-50 employees
Score 2 out of 10
Vetted Review
Verified User
Incentivized
Use Cases and Deployment Scope
Our company uses Zoom for online meetings and inbound/outbound local and international phone calls.
Pros and Cons
  • Online meetings
  • Outbound calls
  • Inbound calls
  • Online management interface is too complicated
  • Difficult to understand customization features
  • Careless tech support
  • Careless billing support
  • Careless sales managers
Likelihood to Recommend
Zoom meeting and phone systems work very well. Had no problems migrating our phone number, making and receiving calls, scheduling and attending meetings.
Nonetheless, Zoom has awful tech and billing support. Our invoices arrived with overage fees that aren't described. The billing support tickets are set to low priority, forcing us to pay the invoices before receiving a response. When responses are sent, they usually point to articles, instead of answering real questions. In the rare occasions somebody decides to answer, they put the blame on us, instead of explaining what the overages are. Reaching out to our sales manager is also useless.
Therefore, although the system works well, in case of problems, you are on your own. It is pointless reaching out to their billing and tech support.
We'll migrate to another service the soonest. Can't stand invoices with charges we don't understand when we have an unlimited plan.

Zoom met our needs during difficult times.

RS
Russ Spranger Sr.
Vehicle manager/it support
RSS TRAILER REPAIR (Transportation/Trucking/Railroad, 201-500 employees)
Score 6 out of 10
Vetted Review
Verified User
Use Cases and Deployment Scope
Our first exposure to zoom was during the lockdowns. We did what we could remotely and did a lot of screen meetings. As good as it is it is not a permanent substituete for face to face interatction. Zoom was easy to set up and use. We would typically have 5-7 remote logins and found it worked as well as we expected. Zoom was not a low dollar solution, We eventually went to Microsoft 365 which allowed Teams as a remote meeting application. There was no sense in our usin g both applications so we eventually went exclusively with Teams.
Pros and Cons
  • Simplicity in administering meetings
  • Stable platform whether using it on a PC or ipad or phone
  • The ability to save meeting formats was helpful, We didnt have to re-do everything each time
  • For me the sharing of a desktop for instructional purposes was more difficult than I expected.
  • Zoom is not the low dollar application. They need to rethink their pricing sructure.
Likelihood to Recommend
Zoom is a good program. I don't feel it has the best security but it is easy to use and served us well during the non-contact period we went through. We were able to have face to face contact wirh remote employees because of zoom. We are not a technical company but Zoom allowed us to function during challenging times.
